title: Join me in the new season as I gather data on my solo queue teammates in OCE.
body:
I will be gathering data on the KDA of my teammates over a few different accounts to try and determine how teammates perform with me doing several different styles.

I will be keeping a record of all my teammates KDA as I play the games in a google doc [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1FSGLqljE5U9W3zwZy0yNfyXdoyexXPHGzyiC63QxgHc/edit#gid=0)

replies.body: I saw the name whitepuma in your google doc. I wouldn't take his stats into account because he is a VERY sub-par player.
I love this cause he is white pumah ðŸ‘Œ
Good one sir, that joke has been made too many times though.
Was gonna provide some help and insight into your problem but then I saw that you're white pumah so I couldn't be bothered.
Then you were not going to provide what I asked for, and you realised that. Well done.
Ayyyy itâ€™s white pumah nice name change buddy

What are you expecting to discover by analysing the kdas of gold players? You have been gold for basically the entire season despite numerous times approaching CHALLENGER teams for a spot. If they can get out of Gold, why can't you? Is that what you're going to determine from wasting hours of your time to feed your own delusions that you're not terrible at League of Legends?

I don't understand the reasoning behind this.

If you think KDA reflects the win rate of low elo players; it doesn't.

> [{quoted}](name=Adriette,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=xIVjdOHn,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-01T12:30:47.526+0000)
>
> I don't understand the reasoning behind this.
> 
> If you think KDA reflects the win rate of low elo players; it doesn't.

Player kda and teammate kda is a good indicator for performance.
With the amount of effort you put into gathering data on your teammates you could have easily improved your own play to resume climbing.

> [{quoted}](name=Yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=xIVjdOHn,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-01-01T02:36:30.318+0000)
>
> With the amount of effort you put into gathering data on your teammates you could have easily improved your own play to resume climbing.

Assuming I haven't already been putting in maximum effort to improve myself for the past 5+ years.
Which would be correct... or your skill ceiling is just, nothing.

> [{quoted}](name=hideto,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=xIVjdOHn,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-01T07:27:03.020+0000)
>
> Which would be correct... or your skill ceiling is just, nothing.

This game has a low skill ceiling relative to other games, very limiting numerical values that are easy to maximize.

> [{quoted}](name=Transcender,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=xIVjdOHn,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-01T10:28:47.141+0000)
>
> This game has a low skill ceiling relative to other games, very limiting numerical values that are easy to maximize.

Low skill ceiling and you're not even top 5%.

Top laugh
That is funny, in sc2 which has an insanely high skill ceiling, I was top 2%.
If only league of legends was starcraft two. Then maybe your statement would have any meaning whatsoever. :(

You are right, sc2 requires much more player input and thought.

Just a heads up for everyone, if it looks like these discussions are going to get out of hand then I am going to stop replying. Whilst I don't mind if people get enjoyment out of it, some people actually take the trolling seriously and I have even had people try to dox me and the god damn scientist who perfectly understands and can mathematically, explain how the system works. so if you are going to be serious in trying to convince me that I am wrong, then you will have to have an equation for us to examine. Everything else WILL be considered trolling.

I said it in a rude way but still they are two very different games and being good at one doesn't translate to the other. im not gonna sit here and argue which game you think is harder/more difficult/higher skill cap. so stating how good you are at starcraft 2 is like me saying im the top player for AFL why am i not the best at Judo

there is a point where one can not improve their own play unless they play with and against people that are slightly better than them (lets say a tier above). professional coaching may be another way but the average person does not have access to professional coaching for a video game. if this person has been the same elo for years he is not going to just simply improve. 

once you're 'stuck' in the 'elo you belong' along with everyone else you're playing with and against, then yes it truly does become just as much about your teammates/opponents as it does about yourself.

the same applies for challenger players. assuming they are all equal, then those matches are decided by everyone's performance in those games, not just "yourself".

I keep being told that I am above the level I am playing at, no matter where I actually play at. I have played on an account in platinum before and I have been called diamond.

I play in gold and I get called high plat.

Silver and get told mid-high gold etc.

Even in the website that got shut down called lol.arenaonline had a "should be" rank based on performance in the current rank, when I was high silver it told me I was low plat.

The constant being that no matter where I play, I consistently perform better than those I play with and against. The enemy has never been a problem for me.

So the purpose of this is simply to find out what makes my teammates play better and use that to try climb with. I notice Apdo playing tf helps his team by being a deterrent for the enemy team when it is a bad situation, he would go through his cards in front of them to threaten a gold card stun if they engaged on his teammate. The difference is, his teammates are smart enough not to see it as thinking they should go in cause he has their back. So I have to explore alternate methods.
You are honestly so bad at this game you need to stop figuring out why it's your team's fault and analyse why it might actually be your fault.

I have been for 5+ years and when I ask people to live coach me so I can compare what they do to what I would do, no one is willing to do it. I find it strange that I am the one person that no one is willing to help in any ways that i ask for. Everyone just repeats saying "it is probably your fault". I agree that the chances of it being my fault are pretty high, but I don't see it and no one has shown me it yet. That and the simple fact that the ranked system literally falsifies its purpose due to it's conditions of a binary result without a matching factor value (win/loss).

Add me in-game.

I'm not qualified to coach but I can offer advice. 

- Adriette
can u offer e advice for being an adc cos I need to carry horribly terrible junglers that don't gank (sorry for the stereotype)
Only if you stop calling other players "shitty".

Things are starting to get out of hand so I'm going to keep an eye on it, but if it escalates I will likely lock the thread. It's pretty heavy on both sides so if you want any comments brought to mod attention please use the report feature and I'll handle them case by case if no-one else gets to them.
Ignore all of the haters. These negative comments have no bearing on statistical analysis. Go for it man, you might learn something that noone else has done.
Holy shit, up voted, commended + seal of approval.
